title: Understanding Lethality Assessment
text: A lethality assessment is a crucial tool used by mental health professionals. It helps in evaluating the risk factors associated with a person's potential for engaging in life-threatening behavior.

title: Components of Lethality Assessment
text: Consider the factors that might be evaluated in a lethality assessment. These could include the person's history, current mental state, and any immediate threats they might pose to themselves or others.

hintAnswer: the structured evaluation of the risk factors associated with a person’s potential for engaging in a $$life-threatening$$ behavior, such as suicide
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes a lethality assessment?
choices: Confining a client in a room from which the client cannot freely exit, used when the client poses an immediate danger to themselves or others
technique where physical or mechanical means restrict a client’s movement
the structured evaluation of the risk factors associated with a person’s potential for engaging in a $$life-threatening$$ behavior, such as suicide
